result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A Kvapil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deferred Agreement vacated.  46 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with:  Jason J. without prior written permission of the agent.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.
Submit a DNA sample.  Successfully complete Drug Court.  Give complete and truthful debriefing regarding illegal drug activities in Chippewa County.  Testify truthfully if required.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to possess syringes unless medically required.  
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.

court minutes filed.
09:45 AM - Cases 18CF426 and 15CF426 and St. Croix Co. Case# 18CF382 consolidated into Chippewa County Case#18CF426
Defendant Ashley Ann Kvapil in court with Attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Defendant Ashley Ann Kvapil in custody.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent in Court.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Filed
18CF426 - Ct. 1 w/ Repeater- Def. waives Preliminary Hearing.  Court accepts waiver.
Information to be e-filed later today.  Cts. 1-4 and now Ct. 5 from St. Croix Co. Case#18CF382 Possession with intent to deliver, Class F Felony. Consolidated into this Chippewa Co. Case#18CF426.
Defendant informed of charges and penalties.
Def. pleads guilty to Cts. 1 and 5.
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.
Acknowledges prior conviction(s).
Factual basis and probable cause found.
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1 and 5; finds pleas as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made.
Sentencing:
Attorney Cohen reads defendant's statement to the Court.
On Revocation Case# 15CF175 -  Court imposes 9 years in Wisconsin Prison System; 4 years Initial Confinement, 5 years Extended Supervision.  
487 days credit. 
$ 0 owed to the Court.
On Consolidation Case# 18CF426 - Ct. 1 - Court imposes 4 years, 10 months in Wisconsin Prison System; 2 years, 10 months Initial Confinement, 2 years Extended Supervision- to run concurrent with Ct. 5 and  15CF175.  
33 days credit.  
Court costs owed of $518.00
Ct. 5 - Court imposes 4 years, 9 months in Wisconsin Prison System;  2 years, 9 months Initial Confinement, 2 years Extended Supervision- to run concurrent with Ct. 1 and 15CF175.  
3 days credit.  
Court costs owed of $518.00

Conditions of Extended Supervison:
-  Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
-  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
-  Not to possess or consume any presciption not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
-  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
-  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
 - Not to possess syringes unless medically required.
 - No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.
-  Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
-  Discuss a reasonable payment amount/plan with agent to re-pay Court costs.
Submit a DNA sample. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.  
Defendant is given copies of Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence for Cases#15CF175 and 18CF425.
